Reviews.Title: “â€˜â€™Taksim Butk Star Hotelâ€™â€™ â€“ Great Location, Nice Hotel and an Enjoyable Stay !”
Reviews.Author: Emin-Azerbaijan
Reviews.Content: Hello Everybody. I would like to write couple words about the â€˜â€™Taksim Butk Star Hotelâ€™â€™. My friend recommend the hotel and We have stayed 4 nights in the â€˜â€™Taksim Butk Star Hotelâ€™â€™ in end of March 2012. We booked the Bosphorus view room and the view was really amazing. The room was big and very comfortable. Hotel is located in the center of Istanbul and you can travel around the whole city very easily, and just a few steps from Taksim Square and Istiklal street where you can enjoy from Istanbul night life. By walking 10 min you can reach the metro system of the city, same time you can reach the tram system & central bus station. Next of the Hotel you can find a lots of restaurants, shops, pharmacy and etc. Our room was well equipped and clean with amazing balcony view to Bosphorus. Also the bathroom was good & well equipped. The wireless (WI-FI) internet connection worked perfectly. The room was cleaning everyday. The breakfast was excellent with the plenty of options. No Comments...............! All hotel employees and Reception Desk are very gentle, helpful and friendly. They are always ready to help us with any queries. I recommend this hotel to everybody. I have no doubts to stay again in the â€˜â€™Taksim Butk Star Hotelâ€™â€™ We had a great holiday in Istanbul. Emin Best Regards

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelloHelloNL
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with very helpful staff, comfortable rooms. Nice location next to Taksim square, although next time I think I would prefer to stay in Sultahnamet.

Reviews.Title: “Taksim Star Butik”
Reviews.Author: Judechina
Reviews.Content: We are teachers in Kuwait, and we get out of the country every time we get a break. Three of us (all women) went to Istanbul for a few days. The Taksim Star Butik was cheap, very central and the room was big.. a very good size for three to share. Lots of space to move around. We had a great view over the Bosphorus (room 502). Everything was nice and clean, and staff were lovely. Don't use the mini bar. Empty it out and get what you need for a fraction of the price at the local mart, which will sell you everything, including beer and wine. Breakfast was included in the hotel price. It was fine...not flash but they had what I like..eggs, toast, sausages, lots of cheese and salad choices, good coffee. Halas! We walked to the main shopping area in 5 minutes, and got a cab to the touristy places we wanted to see. I had previously been to Istanbul and stayed over the other side. If I go back, I think I would go to this side again. It was just so busy, lots of ordinary people going to work every day. We liked the restaurants and loved stopping for a beer, Effes. Great beer.

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull location”
Reviews.Author: zaloupa
Reviews.Content: nice location, tram, metro, bus station, bus stasion for the airport, very close to taksim square. the rooms are simple but good enough, the breakfast is poor, the swiming pool is in another building(xaxaxaxa) ,the double beds in some rooms are small (<2.00m) and the most of the staff spoke english!!!! if you stay in the upper floors you will also have a great view of the city! dont imagine a 4 star hotel but for the right offer and price i would suggest it! we paid 70euro for 2 person/day

Reviews.Title: “Overall bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Troy60795
Reviews.Content: Room was nothing like website photo. No view, small room, no drain plug in bathtub, no robe, syringe in minibar from previous guest, mold in corner or bathtub, staff was unhelpful, unattentive and rude. Would not allow associate to be in room to translate documents, would not allow me to pay for extra person to review sensitive documents for translation in room. I had to move to another hotel room accross the street. I would never stay at this hotel again. - awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel in the heart of my lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Natali R
Reviews.Content: love Star hotel Taksin, because it offers very clean and big rooms, good and kind personal wich is ready to help everytime you ask, and also it has very nice locations close to everything : taksim square, clubs, caffes, restaurants. So when i am in Istanbul i always stay in this hotel because it is comfortable in every case.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't look like the website at all”
Reviews.Author: kelliii
Reviews.Content: I took a long time to decide which hotel i would stay at in Taksim. I was very inpressed by some of the reviews and a bit turned off by others. Unfortunately my stay there was more on the side of the the reviewers that weren't happy. Great Location granted. I didn't see any swimming pool yet they have a pic of one under "Activities"? 31 rooms with garden/city or Sea view. A wall opposite isn't exactly my idea of a garden. Room was tiny. You would open the door and it hit against the strange mattress of the tiny supposed double bed. Walking in this room was difficult as it's so small. Very, very noisy with the sirens, car horns and noisy city folk below. There are 2 hospitals nearby so that's where the sirens kept going/coming to. People in Istanbul seem to use the horn as if it's an essential part of driving. My room was located next to the cleaners room. The banging and noise that was made daily, was really quite annoying. Heating far too hot and no place that you could switch it off yourself. Room wasn't too bad, old carpet and definitely the website enhances it's true worthiness. I could not get the tv to work whatsoever. I'm no dummy but the instruction on how to use the 2 remote control seem to pass by me. Nothing could get it to work. Staff were ok, they weren't friendly how a lot of ppl here say they are. Location is very good because it's 2 mins walk across the road to Istiklal st. You can get breakfast for around 7 euro but i chose most days to go to cafes in the area. I had the breakfast on one occasion it was ok. Coffee maker was off, and other coffee machine didnt work, so instant coffee was the only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Room had issues”
Reviews.Author: keiraned
Reviews.Content: The pillows in my non-smoking room reeked of smoke. Wet bar was unplugged because it couldnt reach the outlet. Room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: pathfm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife visited Istanbul in December 2011. It was our honeymoon trip and we wanted the best of everything, and at the same time be not too extravagant. So, we started our search back in June/July on the internet. We narrowed down to 4-5 hotels and finally called up Butik Star. We asked for a deluxe room with a balcony and Bosphorus view. Since it was off season, we got a good rate for our choice. And for that rate, if you compare with other hotels, the room was really good. It was quite big - appropriate for a deluxe room, had proper lighting, cupboards, electric plugs, curtains... The balcony had a table for two and the view from there was really really amazing. The bathroom was clean and had a good shower system. Buffet breakfast was served everyday from 7 to 10 am and had a huge variety of things to choose from. However, the menu was fixed and it was the same throughout our 10 day trip. The hotel staff is not too vast, so you get to know everyone by 2-3 days. They were all friendly and approachable. One of the best things about this hotel was its location. Its in the Taksim area near Taksim square, hardly 5 minutes walk from the main subway and funikular system, which is a huge advantage considering the taxi rates over there. A lot of good cheap restaurants are also in the proximity like Bambi Cafe. Istiklal Caddessi is like 3 mins away from the hotel, which is a huge huge advantage. We used to go there every night after 8pm when we were done sight-seeing other parts of Istanbul. There were a few drawbacks of this hotel. The staff is very friendly, but almost all of them do not comprehend english very well, which was an obstacle to us when we wanted something which was out of the normal routine. Although the room was cleaned each and every day, we noticed that after 3 days they stopped providing us bath towels and bathroom slippers (maybe they ran out of them or something). The water that came in the washbasin was lukewarm, not hot, as we would have liked it... however the shower didn't have that problem. The bathroom walls were very thin, every now and then we would clearly hear our neighbours go to the toilet, and I'm sure they would have heard us too - not really what we were expecting. The cupboard had a safebox so our passports and money was very safe. Since the staff is not too much at the hotel, sometimes the room service was slow. But they were courteous so it wasn't a big issue. The area around the hotel is pretty upbeat so many different shops are there. The money changers are a little costly as compared to other places like Sultanahmet or Beyazid. My advice to the tourists who are young and full of fun is to book this hotel early on, and get the deluxe room if possible. The best thing is the hot and happening Istiklal street and the proximity to the subway/funikular/tram system. The staff is really friendly and always at your service. If we ever get to visit turkey again we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best location best people!..”
Reviews.Author: Aye G
Reviews.Content: Its wonderful, clean in a perfect street of Istanbul, almost in the square of Taksim, walking down is metro, bridges (Galata) and very close to shopping areas, etc. The best view of the big rooms, you need to ask for a sea view, a bit more expensive rooms but it is worth to experience the mornings and evenings from these rooms! beautiful! Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, great holiday I had..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Taksim Butik Star”
Reviews.Author: Nikoloz T
Reviews.Content: Butik Star is one of the most favorite hotel for me. It is located in the center of Istanbul and you can travel around the whole city very easily. Environment and stuff is very good inside of hotel. The situation is very lovely , especially during New years Eve. the Rooms are comfortable, and personnel is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul..!”
Reviews.Author: Ramazan_891204
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very class, it is so close to the Istiklal street and Taksim square..! And it's nice to return to a room that is cleaned every day, for there is room cleaner everyday, and they do our job good. ! The Heroes in the hotel is "Umut, Baris, Fatih, Hasan, Civan and Burak (Personal)... They are very nice, and had been very helpful. They smile always and are lovely people. We had spend very good times together in the hotel with the personal. They are really amazing, so I am really glad to choose this hotel, because it had been a funny excursion.. I give this hotel 5 stars because all was perfect, the personal, the room and food..! I will choose this hotel again when I travel to Istanbul... Thanks "Butik Star Hotel"

Reviews.Title: “did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Alexa888
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for three reasons; the rooms looked decent, the location was ideal, and the roof bar offered panoramic views of the city. The rooftop bar was closed. The first "double room" we were offered was a tiny room with a single bed dressed as a double. The two pillows side by side did not quite fit on the bed. We flatly refused to take it and were shown to a more reasonable room - but it was still fairly small. And some of the items in the mini-bar were out of date. Staff tried to be helpful but could not communicate in English so their ability to assist was limited. I did notice our room was cleaned very thoroughly and neatly arranged even though we'd slept in and asked for it to be made up later in the day. I received an email ahead of the trip offering assistance but when I replied asking about parking spaces I didn't get an answer, so if you use email to arrange your airport pick up, I'd call ahead to confirm. The location really was the best thing about the hotel. We were right on Taksim Square, close to bars, restaurants, the tram line and local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything!”
Reviews.Author: OLA H
Reviews.Content: A perfect part of Istanbul - You are near shopping, buses, tram .... If You travel alone, make sure You get the price of a singel room!

Reviews.Title: “Special location but not a special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guven
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in October. I booked through one of the biggest travel sites on the web in order to avoid any nasty surprises on arrival. Being an Istanbulite originally, I know that a car par is a tall order in this part of the city. According to the information on the web site the hotel had a car park though, which swayed my decision this way. However when I turned up with my car, I was told that their car par was undergoing refurbishment and was closed (I didn't believe in this story but anyway). I was asked to park in the carpark of the hotel next door at extra cost. The web site also mentioned swimming pool and gym, but having seen the hotel, I didn't even bother checking out these. Overall I was neither pleased nor largely disappointed. It's right in the hear of Taksim, relatively tidy and clean. Don't expect large rooms, as space is a luxury here. When you stay in this part of Istanbul, all you really need is comfortable accommodation and you can get it here. You are surrounded by bars and restaurants, that offer good food/drinks at reasonable prices. Would I go back to this hotel? No. I would rather pay a bit more and upgrade to a full size hotel. Unfortunately the term "boutique hotel" is widely misused in Turkey, and usually means small hotel with inadequate facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Edita V
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister, my aunt and my mom visited Istanbul in October! I booked the hotel over the internet and it was a 3 star hotel so I did`t expect much until I got there. I was pleasantly surprised! The location of the hotel is perfect, Taksim square is the perfect shopping street for those who love shopping! So back to the hotel the rooms are very clean and large! The staff made our stay in istanbul even more special then we hoped for! very friendly staff who will do everything so you enjoy your stay in istanbul! some of them don't speak very well english but you can understand what they talk about so that's not so much of the problem! I would recommend this hotel to everyone!! I would personally wanna thank Ilkay who drove us to the airport when his shift was over because our big taxi didn't come to pick us up! You are the best! I will definitely come back again :) Thank you so much again guys!! Greetings from Norway :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, location & Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sabine A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last January 2011 for 5 days. the hotel is very well located near Istiklal street. the staff are very friendly and very helpfull...room are clean and some with a view to the city. breakfast is good as well, variety and good quality! the only bad thing is that sometime there is a strong bad smell.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Hotel Taksim Butik Star”
Reviews.Author: ArbenCako
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel and the conditions of the room that I booked was excellent (best value for money). I understand that some customers had to pay close to double by the time I was in the hotel, because of short notice in their booking. Me and my fiance enjoyed the stay at this hotel. It was very comfortable, although one night there was some loud music coming from a disco, which is located close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: verunchik
Reviews.Content: Our room 501 has a breathtaking view of the Bosphorus! As we've booked a few months in advance the price was very attractive! Spacious room with bathrobes and a safe provided, bathtub and fan in the bathroom, everything working just fine. Spending only 3 days in Istanbul we didn't have time for television or sitting in the balcony but with a longer stay one would enjoy those. A king-size double bed was very comfortable! Another small bed was available too for storing our clothes )))). WiFi worked fine too though it took a while to get the password. The entrance card for the room worked for only one day then we had to go to the reception desk to change it, caused a bit inconvenience. On Saturday night the disco next door made a bit of noise, but didn't disturb much, just local tea was too strong and kept me awake for half of the night )))) Breakfasts were tiny... Only the first breakfast included fruit, the 3rd (and last) didn't even provide sufficient amount of tea and coffee, no fruit... The location of the hotel is excellent, close to Taksim square, the tram and metro. Bus from Taksim square goes directly to the airport, very convenient! I feel very satisfied! Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ipektrip
Reviews.Content: We arrived hotel as a big group. We communicated with hotel director earlier and he was helpful to accomodate our needs despite the fact that it was a small hotel. They managed to put us all on the same floor and the rooms did not have any problems. the room looking to the street was a bit noisy if you opened the window, othe rthan than hotel staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: Igor Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week in this hotel and my general impression is very good. The location is very convenient with a lot of shops and restaurants around and easy connections to other parts of the city and the airport. Despite of the closeness to the crowded Taksim square it is rather quiet. The rooms are well equipped and clean. I lived in two rooms during the stay. One of them was really big, with a balcony and a wonderful view on Bosphorus. Another one was smaller but also quite convenient. What was important for me, the wireless internet connection worked perfectly in both rooms. It is worth mentioning that the staff is very friendly. I have no doubts to stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: Groumph
Reviews.Content: As we were very pleased with our first experience with this is hotel, it was a obious choice for the second one. We were not disappointed. People are very friendly, rooms are clean any the terrace offers a beautiful 360Â° view. The only reserve is for the breakfast buffet which could and should be improved. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel with excellent staff service and attention”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroSolitario1999
Reviews.Content: All hotel employees are very polite and friendly to their guests. They are always ready to help you with any queries, and most importantly, to answer them satisfactorily. I feel that the rate was in line with the quality and location of the hotel and would happily book there again. I can certainly recommend it to other travelers. It is also a short walk, about 7 minutes, to the Havas airport shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mayya_d_z
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January 2011. The location is OK, room was average: heating was not working properly, furniture and equipment was rather old. The thing that stroke us that the people running the hotel do not respect their customers. My husband reserved the room with Bosphorus view, on arrival, however, we were told that rooms with view are not available. But we paid for the Bosphorus view and the price for that room was different than for the room without view! We didn't get any compensation for that. Our room was on the second floor and the view was awful - just street and garbage bins. Second thing - on their website it is mentioned that they have tea/coffe making facilities in the rooms. It was another lie, they don't. When we asked for it, they didn't even understand what we are talking about, they said that there's nothing mentioned about it on their web-site and they do not allow such facilities in the rooms. Breakfast was very average.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: YousefAlsaadi
Reviews.Content: the best part is the hotel location where you need just few steps to reach Taksim square and Istiklal street. We booked the bosphorus view room and the view was really amazing. The room was big. The negative was the breakfast, very limited and not worth it. also the TV channels where all turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and charming hotel in the middle of center”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaParker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, I was afraid when I read the reviews in here but I was pleased to get a good price,even happier when i arrived and found how good the place is! Location is good,a few minutes walk from Taksim easy access to anywere. Great Bosphorus view from the room. Room was a reasonable size with en suite bathroom . Very clean and modern, can tell its been refurbished recently. Very gentle GM. and friendly personel trying to help in any subject you may need. That was the only negative on a great stay, didnt use the restaurant but looked nice! Some nice london artwork around the hotel too. Il b staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Reliable!”
Reviews.Author: el_pauper
Reviews.Content: I live in Istanbul and for the Christmas weekend, I reserved one of their nicer suites with a balcony and view directly with the manager and when I arrived in the Taksim area later that very same day, I found that they tried to usher me into a different (and lesser) room. When they told me that this was the room I had reserved, I insisted it wasn't and showed the front desk agent my reservation. At that point, he readily admitted that my room was unfortunately already occupied. Upon further insistence on knowing how that was possible, I was given no further information. I asked what else was available and I was told that the only thing available at this time was the room I had just seen, but I would have to pay the same price for this inferior room that I was to be paying for the superior room on my reservation. I simply received my refund and walked away (the benefit of living here full-time) but was forced to scrap my entire weekend of Christmas festivities. I could only imagine the sheer frustration that would have been mine had this been a reservation I had had when traveling to Turkey and not already living here. Upon further contact with the hotel manager the following week, ownership of the situation was not taken by the manager and no explanation or future arrangement was discussed. To me it seemed that they simply are not under the same impressions of responsibility and professionalism that we take for granted in the States and thus one unfortunately can't trust this hotel to ensure their reservation and smooth traveling experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a good value”
Reviews.Author: ilginius
Reviews.Content: My hotel dates was 3-5 january. The hotel is a good location, however the staff was not helpfull, I request a fruit juice to my room and it takes 40 minutes. the room was very small its like a bedroom (toilet or a single room. The bad was very small too. no hot water in the shower. (the worst thing) You can find better hotel with the same price in the same takim square area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel to stay at for several days”
Reviews.Author: MariaKhachaturyan
Reviews.Content: -cosy atmosphere -tiny but clean and well designed rooms -perfect location -friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: We were on business and ended up staying here as we booked late and there was a sporting event in the city - everything else was 300 Euros+. We paid 100 euros here and there is a buffet breakfast which is complimentary for all. When we arrived they seemed to complicate the checkin, not that friendly service. They wanted our voucher etc etc but we had just booked through our work travel agent. They then asked for full payment before we had even seen the rooms! The room we both had was on the front so quite big, It was decorated very traditionally and could probably do with an update but it was clean - remember only 100 euros so you get what you pay for! There was free wifi in the room which was good but just 1 English channel. The hotel was right near Taksim square so its buzzing, you can eat almost all night and the shops are just 2 mins away. At night our rooms on the front were a bit noisy as at midnight there seemed to be parades, horns from cars and people! But at 9am it was quiet! I guess if you pick this location it has its pros and cons. Overall it's not a quality of hotel I would personally choose but it was clean and central.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever and the worst hospitality and service in the world”
Reviews.Author: Mayoosha
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples and we booked 2 double rooms for 2 nights and as soon as we reached the hotel around 12 noon, the receptionist told us that we have to wait for 2 o'clock to enter the rooms and he did for us the Check In procedures and we left our luggages in the lobby and we went to discover the area. when we came back around 3 pm, we met another receptionist that was so rude and she gave us 1 single room and 1 double room that were near to the toilets and not with the other rooms of the hotel, we kept arguing with her and she didn't give us what we already booked for and paid and she didn't want to give us our money back as we booked from a site. we asked her to bring us the manager to talk with and she said that no manager is here and she doesn't know when he will come. we kept shouting and screaming until someone from the hotel told us that the manager is in the other hotel which is near by and we went to him, he apologized but he couldn't do anything to us except that he put 1 couple in the double room below and the other couple in another hotel (star hotel) related to this hotel but it was in the back and very bad too and the couple that stayed in the Butik star found the room extremely dirty and they left the hotel without taking their money and reserved in another hotel to avoid more hassle. It was a horrible day and we never faced such a situation and rude receptionist like this girl and annoying service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory but still a good service and hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Udr75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for work. So it was paid for, it reminded me of an old Hotel that used to be at the top of it's game in a bygone era. The service was not bad all the staff were helpful. It was quiet clean. Single rooms are small but neat. Air conditions were not so great. I had to change rooms as the 1st rooms AC started to drip. But they were very helpful and understanding with a technician arriving at 22.00to try to fix problem

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK, if you are flexible and tolerant, considering that it was your decision not to go to an expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: VTU
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excelent located especially if you like to enjoy night life and shopping, but you have to accept the price for this: not very quite in the night, which may be a problem if your sleep is too sensitive. Room was large (for 3) with a nice - not gorgeous - view of Bosphorous, but it was very cool for April nights, so we asked for some heating, which unfortunately was not solved. 3-4 degrees more would have make the temperature perfect but it was not a very big issue and we managed with long-sleeve pijamas and C-vitamins for the throat! Staff was really kind and always ready to assist, but they were mainly prepared to answer standard questions with standard answers, suggesting mainly tour trips rather than being able to help for a tailor made tour. Breakfast is the worst part of the experience. It was pretty poor (boiled eggs with french fries!), with very limited choices and absolutely no change from one day to another, so if you stay more than 3 days, you will probably end up going out for breakfast. The big issue with breakfast is that the waiter there was not friendly at all, he did not care if we needed something (probably he did not speak english), he did not care about refilling the buffet and most of all he was checking permanently the watch to take everything out if the time limit for breakfast - 10 am was reached, even if there were many people in the breakfast room, who remained unasked if they wish anything before he closes the buffet. If breakast is until 10 am, I undrstand that eventually I can not go for breakfast at 10.01 am, depending of course by the attitude of the hosts towards their clients. However, NO WAY the restorant will close the buffet at 10 am sharp without asking existing guests if they still neeed anything to take! because if I arrived in time, 2 minutes before 10 am, I will not be able to take anyhing if they close it in 2 minutes! This gives a very bad feeling of being watched to consume as little as possible from the buffet and I strongly believe this should not be the way for them to make the profit, but the way the attract and keep their customers happy. This issue should be in fat the only deal-breaker in my decision to return to this place, as I can cope with the others.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and Extra-Small”
Reviews.Author: matilda_in
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is the location. It is really close to Taksim square and to all the means of transfer. Other than that I have nothing good to say. Me and my partner were given a really small room that could barely make for 1 person. The bed was no close to double and there were so many things "decorating" the room, that there was no space for us. When we got into our room I immediately realized that it was not cleaned properly because I found peanuts on the floor. Another disadvantage was the noise. We could here everything that was going on in the corridor and most of the times in the next room! Also, the breakfast was poor and could barely make the european standards. Finally, on our departure they decided to charge us with some things that they claimed we used from the mini bar. After a huge quarrel with the receptionist we had to give them some of the money they claimed we owed them just so they could let us leave and not miss our bus. I have never met more unprofessional behavior and so poor room standards for a hotel that is supposed to be a 3-star.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: dannythyboy
Reviews.Content: Good location, very friendly staff. they eveb arranged me a ticket for a football match with ni extra charge. Only minus our room was rather small, but relatvely quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel. They only need the "petit plus"”
Reviews.Author: edanherg
Reviews.Content: We had a 5-night stay in Butik Star Hotel. The location is simply excellent. Just a few steps from Taksim Square and Istiklal street, you can go wherever you want on foot. If you're hungry, just go down to the street and walk 50 mts and you'll find plenty of cheap options to eat. I'd recommend to stay in this part of the city, since Sultanahmet is nice during the day, but at night is quite lonely and there's no much left to do. The room was totally renovated. it was on the 2nd floor and we weren't bothered by the street noise (there are some night clubs near the hotel). We were two people in each room and I feel it was a bit small. I suggest to take out some of the chairs or small tables so guests can have more space for their luggage. Regarding the breakfast, it was served form 7 to 10 am. Our first morning, we went down at 9:30 am and it was almost no food. Just a few slices of bread, olives and yoghurt. We saw the sausages and eggs tray empty. they never refilled them. I think they should keep refilling the buffet until breakfast closing time. The second morning, we went down at 8 am. There was plenty of options, bread, ham, cheese, cereal, eggs, sausages, etc. BUT the breakfast area was full. We had to wait 10 minutes standing with our plates on hands for a table to sit down. the bad thing was that some 4-people tables were occupied just for one or two people and the staff didn't help to reorganize people so we could all fit in. We got a table and nobody was there to clean it up. I suggest to have more staff during the breakfast for organizing the table sitting. Apart from the details during the breakfast, we had a nice stay. You can get to the top floor and make some beautiful pictures there in the closed down restaurant. By the way, why isn't the roof restaurant working? Thanks again, we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for no sleep and where the breakfast area smells of urine, you've found the place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bond007Winchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March 2010 with 4 mates. Not therefore as fussy as I would have been if staying with my wife etc. There is a nighclub next door. My room on the first floor felt like it was in the nightclub. Cotton wool in the ears didnt help! My friends on the 2nd floor didnt experience the same problem. Beware room 102 area if you want a quiet night's sleep! Overalll the standard of hygiene in Istanbul is not great. This was illustrated by a downstairs staircase in the breakfast area which leads down to the toilet area. If you are lucky enough to sit near this staircase. your poor breakfast, and it isn't that great will be accompanied by the gentle waft of urine.... Would I use this hotel again? Absolutely not! Also, please avoid the 'Irish' pub, the James Joyce...about as Irish as most things that they sell in the Grand Bazarre...they don't even sell Guinness. An absolute joke and one to be avoided.
